content.question:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

<math alttext="W of t equals, the fraction 32 over 5, end fraction, plus, two fifths times, the cosine of, open parenthesis, the fraction pi t over 4, close parenthesis, for 0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 4; W of t equals, 6 plus, one eighth times, open parenthesis, t minus 4, close parenthesis, squared, for 4 less than t, less than or equal to 9"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>6</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mn>4</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

The depth of water in a zoo aquarium at a certain point is modeled by the function <math alttext="W"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined above, where <math alttext="W of t "><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in feet and time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in hours.

(a)   Find <math alttext="W prime of 7"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Using correct units, explain the meaning of <math alttext="W prime of 7"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in the context of the problem.

frqParts.text:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

<math alttext="W of t equals, the fraction 32 over 5, end fraction, plus, two fifths times, the cosine of, open parenthesis, the fraction pi t over 4, close parenthesis, for 0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 4; W of t equals, 6 plus, one eighth times, open parenthesis, t minus 4, close parenthesis, squared, for 4 less than t, less than or equal to 9"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>6</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mn>4</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

The depth of water in a zoo aquarium at a certain point is modeled by the function <math alttext="W"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined above, where <math alttext="W of t "><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in feet and time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in hours.

(a)   Find <math alttext="W prime of 7"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Using correct units, explain the meaning of <math alttext="W prime of 7"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in the context of the problem.

(b)   The graph of <math alttext="W"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is concave up for <math alttext="2 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 2.5"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Use the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="W"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="t equals 2"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to show that <math alttext="W of 2.5, is greater than or equal to 6"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2.5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>≥</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(c)   Find <math alttext="the limit as t approaches 2, of, the fraction with numerator W of t, minus t squared, minus the fraction 12 over 5, and denominator t minus 2, end fraction"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
